subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Fair Trade: Paying Farmers What They Deserve
description: One-minute skill: Fair Trade: Paying Farmers What They Deserve.

hook.text: A coffee farmer in Ethiopia earns about two cents from your five-dollar latte. Fair trade fights that gap.

buildup.text: The movement guarantees minimum prices so farmers aren't crushed when commodity markets collapse.

discovery.text: Fair trade premiums also fund schools, clean water, and clinics in farming communities worldwide.

twist.text: Critics argue only 10% of the premium reaches farmers. Middlemen still capture most of the value.

climax.text: Despite its flaws, fair trade moved over $11 billion in 2022 and raised the bar for ethical sourcing.

punchline.text: The label isn't perfect, but it started the conversation.

quiz.question: What is a major criticism of the fair trade model?
options: It makes products too expensive for consumers to afford
Only a small fraction of the premium actually reaches the farmers
Fair trade certification is free and has no quality standards
